Ct.?Ct: Here is some information about the ct server
Ct.?Key: Enter the key of the ct server, 32bytes
Ct.?Name: Enter the name of the Client to be registered. If the client property exists, enter this parameter
Ct.?IP&?Port: Enter the IP address of the ct server. If you need to listen to external networks, leave the IP address blank

Tcp.?Tcp: Fill in the information for the mount entity service. The ct server ignores this information because it is not needed

Server.?Name: Fill in the name of the service to be registered here
Server.?IP&?Port: This fills in the address that the entity service listens to, and upon receipt of a connection request, requests that address for proxy

Client.?Name: Enter the service name of the client, corresponding to the service name of the other end
Client.?IP&?Port: This is the address that the entity client is going to connect to, and it's going to listen to that address when the program automates
